reviews.text: The food at Eaton Cafe is amazing (especially the Ramen), i love the atmosphere and everyone here is very nice!

The atmosphere, vibe, and staff were extremely welcoming and courteous. I ordered the Pad Thai- the flavor was great, but unfortunately, it was too salty for my taste. It was so salty that I couldnâ€™t finish it after a few bites and even tried mixing it with some boiled vegetables at home, but it was still overpowering. I truly appreciate the warm service and overall experience; I just hope the salt level can be adjusted next time because the actual flavor was very well developed.
It was really nice and chill, not too loud or too much attraction. The food was really good and the noodles were fresh and not instant noodles
Amazing service and the food was so good. The chicken was so juicy and ramen broth was so yummy.
Great food! Amazing service, totally recommended â­ï¸
Amazing food and ice cream!
Best Bakmie and ramen ever in the queens area. The servers (Novi and Daru) are super atentive. Definetely will go back and recommend this Cafe.
We loooove the chicken volcano shoyu ramen!!!
Good food and nice atmosphere
Cozy cafe in Elmhurst with great service and good value for the food!
Excellent service, we order two ramen and taste delicious. Super recommended :)

It was our first time trying Eaton and we all enjoyed it. There is something for everyone on the menu. The broth is so good . The food  came out fast and the staff was friendly and attentive. We will definitely be back to try more items.
We went to Eaton and omg! So many delicious foods! We order double of the pork gyoza! Ramen was fresh and chewy! The garlic oil is divine and we took same cakes home! Definitely will come back!
Loved the food, atmosphere and customer service!

Amazing place! Definitely coming back again.
Food was a 10/10 and the staff were super kind and friendly.
Third visit to Eaton and still hooked â€” Tonkatsu, pork katsu curry, and shaved ice win every time!
The food was really good. My kids loved it. From takoyaki to calamari to tonkatsu and ramen. You will never ran out of options and they are all great!
Good Food, Great service, will definetly be coming back! ğŸ¤©ğŸ¤©
Very excellent delicious food and customer service!!
Excellent food and customer service!!

The food was great and the place is very spacious, I really wanted to give 5 stars but my only problem was the service, there was a miscommunication with two orders that ultimately we had to still pay for even though we didn't ask nor want it. I worked as a server I know it can be hard with a larger party but still, to pay for the meal we didn't want was wild to me. I never heard of that before
So good  i would go again
Great staff and yummy food and ambience! ğŸ˜‹
Great food with friendly staff!

Iâ€™ve walked past this restaurant many times since it opened, and I finally had the chance to give it a try. The place is clean, and I was seated right away. The menu is huge with so many great options to choose from.

I started with the pork soup dumplings â€” they were amazing, perfectly flavored and delicate. The popcorn shrimp leaned a little sour for my taste, but still enjoyable. The pork bun was another highlight: soft bun, fresh veggies, and great balance overall.

For entrees, we tried the Volcano Tonkatsu and the dry ramen with chicken. Both were excellent â€” the tonkatsu had a rich, flavorful broth, and the dry ramen was just as satisfying.

Overall, I highly recommend this spot and encourage supporting this wonderful small business in the neighborhood!
So gooooooood!!!!

My husband and I come here maybe 2-3x a month and they never disappoint. I donâ€™t think Iâ€™d prefer any other noodles spot more than this place - the volcano tonkatsu ramen is sooo good! My husband loves the curry chicken katsu. Their service - two usual ladies at front, Maria and younger woman - are so kind and friendly. We will come back soon and have some ice cream too!
The food was great for its price
Flavorful food with great service and they have unique bakery options too
Great taste and portions, fair prices and lovely staff. Please visit ğŸ¥°
Yummy food. Very good service
Everything is top notch.. ramenn especially â¤ï¸
Pretty good!
I loved  the food. The chicken wings and the Ramen where my absolute favorite thing. The thi ice tea was also really good. The customer service was excellent.  10/10 would recommend.
They serve a variety of Asian dishes. I tried the batagor which was good and not common. I also enjoyed their service!
The food is good if this restaurant is not far from my house I think Iâ€™ll be here every day. Plus the staff here is so friendly

Wonderful restaurant, excellent service, nice store at front with seemingly southeast Asian delicacies and snacks.
We return once a month.

One minor complaint -there are commercials on the radio that is played in the restaurant .
Delicious food and nice atmosphere. Iâ€™d definitely come back~ itâ€™s a comfort foodd
Food is really delicious, and staff are really friendly. :))
Best comfort food ever. Bebek galangga paling enaaaaaak

Best Thai tea I have ever had.
Maria was the best waitress .
10/10 would go again.
the food is very delicious, good service, nice and relaxing place, love the rame, never disapointed
Come back here at Eaton Cafe for more than 10 times, just for combo noodle, its supper

Eaton Cafe is a great place to go to if you want to satisfy your hunger. The meals are very filling and the atmosphere is very cozy, like a cafe should be. Come here for a quick bite or a hearty, homemade Asian meal!
Eaton cafe has wonderful food and service, and itâ€™s what makes my family come back every time. If you want a quick, tasty, and filling meal, Eaton is definitely the place to go!
The best FOOD!
its really nice, the service was good, food was delicious, recommended
the foods were good and fresh
The space was very calm, with very nice service. I enjoyed the sweets and my time in this establishment.
This place has the best Indonesian mie komplit in New York. Overall food was great. They also have a nice Indonesian selection in their bakery! Highly recommend.

Eaton has become my absolute go-to spot! The fried duck, fried rice, and combination noodles are simply unbeatable â€“ perfectly spiced every time, never bland, and bursting with flavor. Itâ€™s the kind of Indonesian fusion comfort food that keeps you coming back again and again.

The cherry on top? Their Mr. Greentea ice cream â€“ refreshing, unique, and the perfect way to end a meal. They even have tasty snacks to go, super easy to bring home and enjoy later.

Service is always friendly and fast, and the food comes out fresh, beautifully presented, and delicious. Every visit feels like a treat. If you want food that wows both your eyes and your taste buds, this is the spot. Highly recommend!

Definitely coming back here!! I got the vegetable shoyu as a vegetarian option and I will say this- it was so hardy and packed with flavor! The spring rolls were packed and cooked to perfection! My friend got the chicken karaage shoyu and she said it was delicious as well! Over all, food was very comforting. The prices are also perfect for the portion size. The ambience was chill and the decor was so cute - a great spot to go with friends and the menu has so many options so definitely something for everyone! The staff were all so sweet too! There were also so many deserts and beverage options. Gonna have to come back to try more of the menu!!

What can I say to this simple restaurant thatâ€™s almost perfect in every aspect!
The service is superb! All of the servers are very accommodating and really kind.
Chef Steve is truly putting all his heart and effort to serve the the best foods on your table.
All of their menu are very good with very affordable prices that you canâ€™t find anywhere.
If youâ€™re hungry, just come here and theyâ€™ll serve your food as fast as they can.
Donâ€™t forget to try their deserts- the tiramisu and napoleon are the best that you can find in New York!
The ambience/atmosphere here is very delightful, clean and spacious. Very family friendly!
This our familyâ€™s no.1 favorite restaurant in Queens, we always come here almost all the time.
I highly recommend this place to everyone!

The noodles are wok-tossed with scallions, bean sprouts, and egg, creating a simple yet deeply flavorful plate thatâ€™s all about texture and balance.

The ambiance at Eaton is relaxed and welcoming, and the staff are always friendly. Whether youâ€™re dining in or grabbing takeout, this dish is a solid pick for noodle lovers looking for something authentic and satisfying.

Eaton is hands down one of my favorite spots for Asian fusion. The food is always fresh and full of flavor. The fried chicken and fried duck are unbelievableâ€”crispy, juicy, and honestly to die for. I wasnâ€™t expecting them to be that good, but now theyâ€™re a must-order every time I go.

The staff is friendly and quick, which makes the whole experience even better. Iâ€™ve been here a couple of times now and it never disappoints. If youâ€™re looking for a place that does fusion right, I highly recommend Eaton.

Unfortunately the best thing going for it is the Tonkotsu Ramen, had I only tried this Eaton would be a solid 4/5 â­ï¸

The noodles quality and skill provides that perfect tooth feel, bite.

The karaage Chicken could be better seasoned via a brine and benefit from a double fry. The meat was also ok the dry side.

The fried rice was on the soft side, but the flavour was there.

last time I had the hainan chicken, braised pork, and combo pork for my brunch and it was a wonderful experience to try asian cuisine for the first time, definitely comeback to try another great food!!

Obsessed with this new gem near Queens Mall â€” Eaton in Elmhurst is officially my favorite spot! ğŸ’›
They serve up a delicious mix of ramen, authentic Indonesian food ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡©, homemade baked goods, and a super fancy dessert selection (the Indo sweets & snacks are chefâ€™s kiss ğŸ‘Œ). Everything is sooo yummy, and the vibes? Cozy, welcoming, and perfect for anything â€” from a chill lunch to a little gathering with friends.
Amazing food + warm service = total win. If you havenâ€™t checked it out yet, youâ€™re missing out!

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸ A Hidden Gem in the Heart of Queens! Such a cute spot right in the heart of Queens! The food selection is wonderfully varied, which makes it perfect for trying out different flavors and cuisines in one place. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, with authentic music playing in the background that really adds to the vibe. Overall, a great experience â€” definitely a place Iâ€™d come back to and recommend to others looking for something special!
Good food ğŸ‘ğŸ¼ been here twice did not disappoint. Had the fried duck and combo noodle with meatballs. Definitely a taste that brings you home
The broth was rich but not too salty, the noodles had a perfect chew, and the toppings tasted so fresh. It felt like a homemade meal made with care and the portion was just right!!

My husband and I really loved the food, the customer service was amazing and the music selection was great.I got the Combo Noodles with Fish Balls, He got the crabmeat fried rice and it was all delicious 10 out of 10 on atmosphere, food and customer service ğŸ«¶ğŸ½ğŸ«¶ğŸ½ğŸ«¶ğŸ½
Delicious and tasty asian fusion, mainly rich indonesian savoury influenced. Friendly staff. Decent portion. Clean ambient. Definitely will come back and recommended.
We ordered tonkatsu ramen with extra noodles and also fried chicken with rice. The food was so delicious. The chili sauce was so spicy, I liked it so much. Will definitely come back soon.

Authentic ramen taste! Good ambiance, very clean and food is served efficiently. They have a variety of options from rice bowls to ramen and even dim sum. They also have pastries and desserts. Lots of seating options and a cute teddy bear and back drop in the corner for pictures. I recommend trying this place out

Eaton Cafeâ€™s Chicken Katsu Curry would be stamped with bold flavor and crispy perfection. The katsu itself is golden and crunchy, sliced into tender strips that hold up beautifully under the rich Japanese-style curry. The curry sauce is savory, slightly sweet, and has just enough spice to warm you up without overwhelming the palate.

My wife had a stomach upset after the dinner. The Ramen soup is bit oily too.

The service and ambience were nice though. It looks a new restaurant in town.

Went here for lunch with my friend and we both had a great experience. Definitely one of the best ramen Iâ€™ve ever had! The chicken karaage ramen was delicious and full of flavor, and their portions are really generous. We also had the thai iced tea, spring rolls, and shaved ice. Everything tasted amazing! The atmosphere was cozy, and the staff was incredibly nice and attentive.
Clean. Big portions and reasonable price! Would definitely come back again. A staple in the neighborhood with great ramen just in time for winter/colder months

It's not a dedicated ramen spot, so I was surprised that the ramen was decent. They sell other types of food too if you don't want ramen. We got the tonkatsu ramen and chicken karaage "tsukemen". Decent portion size. I really like that the ramen soup wasn't very salty. The chicken karaage was the best out of everything I ate. I didn't get the dessert b.c the cakes looked old. The bakery goods on the other hand, I'll be back to try that.

I took off a star because the menu said tsukemen, which is dipping noodles, but they actually meant mazesoba or abura soba---dry ramen (no soup). I suggest changing the menu b.c it's misleading. Also, the thai tea was not good. It was overly sweet and tasted like canned thai tea or heavily watered down. Air circulation needs a bit work; felt like the oil was stuck to the air. Other than mentioned, it's a decent spot to eat at. The restaurant was clean and spacious. Service was nice; the waitresses were attentive.

Total for dinner was a little over $36 for two orders and a drink after tax and tips. They have happy hours from 4pm to 6pm, I think. And there's a promo going on: buy one main dish, get the second 30% off. Not sure when that's over.

Stumbled over this place while going for a walk down Queens Boulevard and was drawn in by its charming atmosphere and signage. The food was so delicious, the service was fantastic and attended, and the vibes were just great in general. Highly recommend coming here and enjoying the chicken, sticky rice and the lapis Pepe.

The ramen and galanga chicken flavors were great! I was surprised by how good the ramen was, considering it's not a Japanese restaurant. The galanga chicken was also tasty albeit a little dry - I didn't mind it though as the paired sauce made up for it and was delicious. We got a matcha crepe cake for dessert and it tastes good but the texture isn't as expected for a crepe cake - the layers were very thick. The top layer was also harder and dried out possibly from being open to the air inside the display case? I would still come back here to eat again as the food tastes good and the staff are super friendly. The cafe also plays music at a nice volume so that it's not too loud. I didn't get a chance to try their pastries but they are nearly arranged and look good! Overall, Eaton is a welcome addition to the neighborhood.

Daru and Maria were above and beyond in their service. The place has a lot tables and the food was really delicious. The menu has a lot to offer and food items are high quality! Daru even gave me extra katsu sauce.
Great food! Ramen was not overly salty. Friendly service! Dining area was super clean, spacious and well-lit!

The place beautiful, we can take picture with giant bear doll. They have many seats and bright ambiences ğŸ¥°

For the food : They have ramen ğŸœ, fried rice, and other kind of noodles. They also have cookies ğŸªâ€” I tried : kastengel, flower shape cookies & palm cookies. That 3 was GOOD ğŸ¤¤ you have to try next time.

They also have cakes ğŸ° and traditional snacksâ€¦ there is fried tofu filled with veggie â€”> thats delicious ğŸ¤¤â€¦ also there is different kind of empanadas : 1 filled with ham & mayoâ€¦ 1 filled with other things called : rougut. I love the one with rougut one. ğŸ¤¤

If you read this review, you have to try EATON CAFE next time. It just across from Queens Mall or Target Mall.

This place offers a delightful experience. The food was absolutely fantastic, and the staff was incredibly friendly and welcoming. The cafe is spacious and well-maintained, providing a comfortable and clean atmosphere. The pastries were adorable and delicious, and the teriyaki dry ramen was simply outstanding. My husband tried the torigara chicken shoyu, and he was astounded by its exceptional taste. The latte was refreshing, and the Thai iced tea was simply amazing. I canâ€™t wait to return soon! ğŸ˜

Probably the best ramen I've had in a long time. Super friendly service too and a nice, clean place.
Highly recommend if you're in the area.

The place was kind of new when we visited. The food was good. The dining area feels very open and bright. They also have baked and desert goods.
It was my first time stopping by, and I was not disappointed. The service was wonderful and the food was delicious. I canâ€™t wait to stop by again !
Definitely will come back! The food was so delicious and big portions! The service was excellent! My children also like the food and their desserts!

A place to get some decent noodles and plenty of snacks, too. Ramen was a bit lackluster, marinated egg and chashu was cold, and the noodles were a bit on the sticky-chewy texture side of things, but otherwise, not bad. Takoyaki was ok too, got plenty of octopus in there. Got good stuff, but I might wanna try something else here...

My experience here at Eaton Cafe was great.
People were very warm and welcoming and so was the food!! Would also recommend the Chicken Katsu Curry, I also added mushroom and bamboo side to it which was great and ended with the Eaton Shaved ice cream (big portion good for two people) very yum !!

Was recommended to dine in by a local friend and was not disappointed. Bought the â€œGado Gado saladâ€ and â€œVolcano Ramen.â€ Seriously impressed by how it tasted really authentic. 10/10 will come back as a regular customer!

My kids always get the tonkatsu karaage and itâ€™s delicious! I got the chicken katsu curry and was very good! Big portions too. So there is no space for desserts ğŸ˜‚ we might try their ice cream next time.5
they are now serving dimsum, we tried the pork shumai and the shrimp shumai, both were delicious, the soy sauce that came with it was on the sweeter side, would love for it to be on the salty side or plain soy sauce would be nice too. But all in all great experience! Weâ€™ll be coming back! Weâ€™ve been here 4 times since it opened. Thank you Eaton!

Finally a great Asian Cafe in Elmhurst, Queens! This cafe got almost every Asian dish in one place, even serve Chinese dim sum! Pad Thai, curry, Ramen, tonkatsu, Indonesian dishes and Bakery. Also got ice cream, including the rare red bean flavor! We went for lunch and went back for afternoon tea for coffee and delicious thousand layer cake! Service is great and food is quite authentic with reasonable price.
